model:
&types;
User Interface
Enable Key Lock
0 Set the Lock mode.
Enable Key Lock Password
1
Set whether to use a password to change the Lock mode settings
Enable Mannermode
0
Set the phone to only vibrate on alert.
Enable Error Indication
1
Set the error message display function
Use Advanced Rate Set
0
Set the function to display the TX Rate currently being used in the UI
Dial Number Font Size
Small 0
Large 1
0 Set the font size
Key Tone Volume
3
Network Setup Menu Location
User Menu 0
Admin Menu 1
1
Location for the network setup menu
SIP Menu Location
User Menu 0
Admin Menu 1
1 Location for the SIP setup menu
Phonebook - Use Index Setting
1
Enable pre-programmed memory dial send function
Global System Settings
Display Language
Japanese 0
English 1
French 33
Spanish 34
Swedish 46
German 49
1
Set the language for the phones display
Country Tone Type
USA 1
Japan 81
South Africa 27
Greece 30
Netherlands 31
Belgium 32
Spain 34
Italy 39
Switzerland 41
Austria 43
United Kingdom 44
Denmark 45
Sweden 46
Germany 49
Brasil 55
China 86
HongKong 852
1
Set the language for the phones display
TFTP Server IP
0.0.0.0
Specifies the TFTP Server address to get the user.ini file from (basically the file that gets generated out of this configuration system)
Administrator Password
The central administration password for this device
Use DNS SRV
1
Enable the use of DNS SRV Records to resolve SIP URIs
Watchdog Timeout
120
How long for the phone to be allowed to be non responsive until the built in watchdog reboots the phone
LCD Contrast
-4
-3
-2
-1
0
1
2
3
4
0
Set the contrast of the phones display
Web Server
1
If checked, the HTTP server will be enabled.
Dynamic Network
Backoff Interval
4,8,16,32,64
Back off interval if a NetworkFail occurs (Unit: seconds)
DHCP Verify Count
3
Set the number of times to send a DHCPRequest to the DefaultGW after L3 roaming. (Unit: Number of times)
DHCP Verify Interval
3
Set the interval at which to send a DHCPRequest to the DefaultGW after L3 Roaming. (Unit: seconds)
802.1X Bind Timeout
15
802.1X timeout value (Unit: seconds)
WMM Priorities (Disabled for model 5000)
Precedence 0
0
Set the WMM priority for Precedence0
Precedence 1
6
Set the WMM priority for Precedence1
Precedence 2
Set the WMM priority for Precedence2
Precedence 3
Set the WMM priority for Precedence3
Precedence 4
Set the WMM priority for Precedence4
Precedence 5
Set the WMM priority for Precedence5
Precedence 6
Set the WMM priority for Precedence6
Precedence 7
Set the WMM priority for Precedence7
Service Lamp
Enable Service Lamp
1
Red Alert Antenna Level
0
1
2
3
3
Set the antenna level to be low in the Service Lamp LED. This function operates if the low antenna level that has been set is reached
Indication Interval
10
Interval at which to advertise the Service Lamp LED (Unit:seconds)
Indication Mode
Lamp only 0
Lamp and Beep 1
0
SIP
Primary SIP Proxy kkk
Primary SIP Registrar
Secondary SIP Proxy
Secondary SIP Registrar
Authentication Realm
Register Expiry
3600
The validity time of the registration at the SIP server after which reregistration should occur

1

Manual 1
0

DHCP
1
Use DHCP to configure IP address, netmask, dns and gateway

WiFi Security Settings
Enable WEP
0
Enable Wireless Encryption Protocol
Security
None 0
WEP 1
WPA-PSK 2
0
Set the kind of security used on the WiFi network
WPA-PSK Passphrase

WEP Keylength
64bits 0
128bits 1
256bits 2
0
Keylength for the WEP encryption key

1

WEP Key 3
WEP Key 4
WEP Authentication Algorithm
Auto 0
Open 1
Shared Key 2

Post Authentication
The Hitachi Cable Wifi phones can authenticate to 802.1X authentication systems as well as to web based hotspot authentication pages via the User Authentication Module (UAM) service in the phone
Post Authentication Mode
None 0
Web 1
8021x-MD5 2
8021x-TLS 3
8021x-PEAP 4
8021-TTLS 5
0
Which type of Post Authentication to use.
8021X Name
Name used for 8021X Authentication
8021X Password
Passwword for 8021X Authentication
UAM Use Manual
0
Wether to use manual setup for WEB authentication
UAM Login URL
Set the login URL for WEB authentication (Ex. http://sipfoundry.org/login.html)
UAM IDTag Name
Set the NAME attribute usd in an INPUT tag in the login form for the ID
UAM PWTag Name
Set the NAME attribute usd in an INPUT tag in the login form for the Password
Set to the URL to access for the first packet. (Ex. http://10.1.1.1 , http://hitachi-cable.co.jp)
UAM ID
Username used for WEB authentication
UAM Password
Password used for WEB authentication

60

Time and NTP
Date Format
YYYY/MM/DD Sun 0
YY/MM/D Sun 1
MM/DD/YYYY Sun 2
MM/DD/YY Sun 3
Sun DD Jan, YY 4
0
Set the format the Date is displayed
24h Format
0 Display time in 24 hour format
Enable NTP
1
Enable Time synchronisation via the NTP protocol
NTP refresh Interval
7200
Time in seconds between NTP re-syncs.
Primary NTP Server
Address of the primary NTP server.
Secondary NTP Server
198.144.202.251
Address of the secondary NTP server.
Offset from GMT
Set the offset from GMT in + or - hh:mm
Enable Daylight Saving
1
If checked, apply daylight savings rules to displayed time.
DST Start Month
Month to start DST. 1=Jan, 2=Feb, ..., 12=Dec
DST Start Day
0 Day of the month to start DST.
DST Start Hour
Hour to start DST, in 24 hour clock. 2=2 am, 14=2 pm
DST Start Minute
Minute to apply DST.
DST End Month
Month to end DST. 1=Jan, 2=Feb, ..., 12=Dec
DST End Day
0 Day of the month to end DST.
DST End Hour
Hour to end DST, in 24 hour clock. 2=2 am, 14=2 pm
DST End Minute
Minute to end DST.
Advanced SIP
Local Port
5060 Local port number used by SIP
500
SIP Timer T1, value in miliseconds, 0 disables
4000
SIP Timer T2, value in miliseconds, 0 disables
5000
SIP Timer T4, value in miliseconds, 0 disables
Timer B
0
SIP Timer B, value in miliseconds, 0 disables
Timer F
0
SIP Timer F, value in miliseconds, 0 disables
Use User Agent
0
Enable the addition of the User-Agent Header to SIP messages
User Agent Name
HitachiWirelessIP
Define the string used in the User-Agent Header
Use Version On User Agent
0
Add a version string to the User-Agent header
Use Vendor ID On User Agent
0
Add Vendor-ID to the User-Agent Header
Use MAC On User Agent
0
Max Forwards
70
Retry Hold On 491
1
Set whether to retry if 491 is received as a hold request response
Caller ID Mode
Default 0
Private 1
RFC3325 3325
0
ICT Transaction Max Count
10
Set the maximum value of the Invite Client Transaction (ICT)
Use Rport
0
Set whether to use the RPORT function
Options Expire
20
Set the Options Expire time Unit:(second)
Request REFER Timeout
200
Set the time from when ACK(INVITE/HOLD) is sent after the transfer boot until REFER is sent (0 disables)
Wait REFER Response Timeout
8000
Set the Timeout(BYE) time after REFER has been sent. (Unit: ms, 0 disables)
180 Retransmission Interval
60
Set the 180Ringing resend interval (0 disables)
Invite Expire
180
Sets the timeout for SIP INVITE messages (0 disables)
Reuse Auth Header Within Dialog
0
Set whether to use Authorization header again when in the same dialog
Reuse Auth Header On Register
0
Set whether to use Authentication header when Re-Registering
Register Contact Change
two contact header (Contact:old-address,Expires:0, Contact:new-address,Expires:xxx)
0
one contact header (Contact:new-address,Expires=xxx)
1
0
Set the Contact header format for when IP address is changed. (L3 Handover/Roaming)
Use Remove All Contact
contact="*" --> RFC3261"10.2.2 Removing Bindings"
0
contact="IP address" 1
1
Set the Contact header format for when powered off
Use Random Contact
0
Set whether to use random Contact header for some SIP server. Ex) When set to On. sip:random value@phone_ip_address
Retry To Redirect Contact
1
Set whether to use 3xx redirection
Auth Retry Count
1 Set the retry count for 401/407
Retry Register After Auth Fail
0
Set whether to retransmit Register when failed
Ignore 183 Without SDP
0
RTP/RTCP
Use RTCP
1 Enable the use of RTCP
RTP Port Min
9000
Minimum port number that can be used by RTP
RTP Port Max
9020
Maximum Port number that can be used by RTP
RTCP Report Interval
5000
Interval for sending RTCP (Unit:ms)
RTCP CNAME
WirelessIP5000
Character string entered into CNAME for RTCP Messages
Last RTP Received Timeout
0
Set the RTP monitor function. If set to 0, disable the RTP monitor. If performing RTP packet monitoring and the RTP packets are not sent for XX seconds, BYE is sent. (Unit: Seconds)
SDP
Use Increase session id
0
Define whether to add the owner session ID if the SDP details are changed

Basic Call Settings
Busy Tone Count

Set the BT length adjustment (Unit: seconds)
Transfer Busy Tone Count
10
Set the BT count for when transfer is rejected
Call Waiting Tone Count
1
Number of times the interrupt sounds during CallWaiting. (-1:infinte, 0:disable, 1 ~ 10:count)
Reject Hold Request On Hold
0
Set the duplex save prohibition function. This function prohibits the person on hold from holding. Prohibits two people from holding by using a 403 response to the person using the hold function to an INVITE from the person on hold. If turned ON, this setting does not permit duplex holding.
Reject Hold Request On 2Calls
0
Set whether to reject multistage transfer
Block Request Hold On Holded
0
This function prohibits INVITE being sent by the person on hold pressing and holding down the SEND button
Session Expire
1800
Set the session expire time. (Unit: seconds)
Ringing Timeout
180 Ringing Timeout in Seconds
Update RBT
0
et waether to update the RBT for multiple 18x responses. If set to OFF, the operation will conform to RFC3261 13.2.1
Dial Sending Timeout
30000
Set the time until Cancel is sent if there is no response from the default Invite. (Unit: ms, 0 disables)
Check Alias In Call List
1
Set the function to not make a new call if checking wether there is a specific alias in the call list of urrent conversations, and the specific alias is present. In other words if set to ON, communications with the terminal that is Alias:100 will be put on hold, and if redialed using 100, an ErrorTone will occur
Remove DASH On Alias
1 Delete "-" from phone numbers
Use Silent Packet On Mute
0
Send RTP packets when set to mute
Echo Canceller
1
Use the hardware echo cancellation routines on this network connection ?
Reject Invite During BT
1

20

30
Set the time the BT sounds until returning to the converation (while on hold). 0 disables

4
Sets the time until sending after dialing a number. (Unit: seconds)
Use Overlap Send on Hold
1

INFO 1

0
Set the DTMF auto selection function. Select to prioritize RFC2833 if 2833 is displayed in ON (SDP) or OFF (Send using DTMF, which is set using Mode.) If 2833 is not displayed in the SDP, send using DTMF, which is set using Mode.

RxLevel Association Threshold
-69
If the AP signal level pertaining to the profile with the highest priority when the network starts is lower than the entry vaue, the priority is ignored, and connection is made to the AP with the highest signal level from the Join-Methods which have a profile of Auto

1
How often to perform the scan (in total, NOT per channel)
Scan Mode
Active Scan 0
Passive Scan 1
0 Set the Site Scan mode.

Roaming Settings
Try Beacon Signal Level
-79
Set the threshold of the electromagnetic wave reception level the processes AP scans. Unit(dBm)
Try RxLevel
-79
Set the threshold of the electromagnetic wave reception level that processes AP scans. Unit (dBm). AP scan is processed when less than the Try_RxLevel during call
Try Rx Signal Level
-79
Set the threshold of the electromagnetic wave reception level that processes AP scans. Unit (dBm). AP scan is processed when less than the Try_RxLevel during call
PreRoaming Enable RxLevel
-59
Set the threshold of the electromagnetic wae reception level that processes AP scans. Unit (dBm). Process AP scans when below the Try_RxLevel but do not process AP scans if the system recovers to PreRoaming_Enable_RxLevel and than falls below the Try_RxLevel again
Try Over TxError Count
10
Set the threshold for the number of transmission error occurrences produced when the handover and roaming operation is performed. If ACK in IEEE802.11 is not returned, the count is incremented and if the count exceeds the threshold value, handover and roaming are performed.
Try Over RxError Count
10
Set the threshold for the number of recieve error occurrences produced when the handover and roaming operation is performed. If the retry flag is set in the 802.11 header in the unicast packet, the count is incremented and if the count exceeds the threshold value, handover and roaming are performed.
Level Diff Higher Than Current Site
10
Set the threshold of the electromagnetic wave reception level that performs handover and roaming operations. Set the threshold value to the difference between the electromagnetic signal level received from the currently associated AP and the AP to be associated with next. If the signal level from the currently associated AP falls below the Try_RxLevel, perform Handover and roaming if the difference between the currently associated AP electromagnetic signal level and the signal level of the next AP that is trying to associate reaches Level_Diff_Higher_Than_Curr_Site. Depending on the system, it may be necessary to calculate suitable values
Use Refresh PreRoaming
1
Set wether to scan when going into awake mode and checking association status.
Enable PreRoaming On Association 0
PreRoaming Mode 0
PreRoaming Refresh Interval 0
Clear Blacklist Interval
60
Set the interval to clear the AP List which WIP failed to associate to. Unit: Seconds
